intro: Marshalljohnstonia gypsophila, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale blue or white flowers that appear in umbels, giving it a ghostly appearance.
